results.description:
ADMISSION TO WELLNESS EVENT IS FREE.

Transform your health at the  Marshfield Branch, YWCA Cambridge Healthy Living Magazine Fair.
If you’re ready to take control of your health, have more energy, and live more fully, Healthy Living Magazine and Marshfield Branch, YWCA Cambridge programs may be what you need. The two groups are combining efforts to offer a free family wellness fair Saturday, May 7, from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the YWCA on Ferry Street.
 
From 10 a.m. to 3 p.m., two unique yoga retreats will be offered in the rustic atmosphere of the YWCA barn to encourage you to make positive lifestyle changes.  Price per yoga retreat is $40 per person. First, Kripalu-trained yogi Kerry Anne McCarthy will lead a vinyasa yoga retreat from 9 a.m. to noon, and then local yogi Bea Whalin will lead a  renewing yoga retreat from 1 to 3 p.m. 
 
Outside the barn, the health fair will open for public at 10 a.m. and is free for all. The family wellness fair will offer information on Marshfield Branch, YWCA Cambridge programs, nutrition advice from local vendors including Juice Plus and Isagenix, eco-safe cosmetics, local jewelry artisans, alternative therapies, Kingston massage therapist Dee Davidson of Simply Soothing Sanctuaries will set up a meditative labyrinth and North River Family Chiropractic will be offering free postural screenings. World-renowned children’s book publisher (WHO, though?) Usborne Books, will offer children’s story time. HeaLthy Living Magazine will be on hand to offer free copies of the magazine.
 
Healthy Living publisher and wellness guru Candita Mamet said the magazine and Marshfield Branch, YWCA Cambridge decided to join efforts to promote the health and wellness of women and their families. “The goal is to help us all become our best selves,” said Mamet.
 
Located on a beautiful salt marsh in Marshfield Hills, Massachusetts, the Marshfield Branch, YWCA Cambridge offers a nurturing and healing environment that makes change possible. Taught by the South Shore’s leading health, nutrition, lifestyle, yoga and fitness professionals, Healthy Living Magazine will be offering programs at YWCA to include educational workshops, yoga and mindfulness instruction, health talks, fitness activities, and all-natural meal planning. 
 
Transform your life with programs like: Nutrition and Cooking, Detox for Health and Healing, Digestive Health: A Holistic Approach, or Integrative Weight Loss, to name a few. With so many different programs to choose from, you’re sure to find a perfect fit. 

We asked Kim Nashawaty Director of  the YWCA Cambridge, Marshfield Branch to share with us her excitement about these new programs offered by Healthy Living Magazine, she states 
"We are very excited to work with The Healthy Living Magazines to promote good health and well being to woman and their families.  If we don't take care of ourselves properly we cannot continue to give to our families and others properly"

We're at that perfect age - old enough to have some wisdom, young enough not to be sticklers. We want to create real friendships in our age group which we recognize takes time and investment. We want to get to know other intellectually curious, open-minded, professionals. 


We recognize that not every couple can make it out every month when we will have a dinner, but by keeping this Meetup to 8 to 12 open-minded, charming, inquisitive pairs we know this Meetup will be *different*. Dinners will be held in good but not break-your-bank restaurants and gastropubs within 6-7 miles of Newton, MA. Broad topics for discussion might include: - Should campaign finance be reformed? - Are we losing our passion for long-form reading of books with social media? - Should schools mandate teaching a second language? - Is the pace of change of society getting quicker or are we just getting older? - Should prostitution be legalized and regulated? - Is Massachusetts living up to its full potential? We look forward to spending time as a group!

results.description:
Information and Communications Technology [ICT] is an extended term for information technology which stresses the role of unified communications and the integration of telecommunications, devices as well as APIs, software, middleware, storage, and audio-visual systems that enable users to create, access, store, transmit, secure and manipulate communications. 

The concepts, methods and applications involved in ICT are evolving on an almost daily basis and the purpose of this meetup to get together to learn and keep up with the advances. results.description:
This meet-up hosts family-friendly board game nights for those in East Cambridge and beyond. The fact that it's an inclusive group made up of singles as well as parents (with kids) makes it unique in the Greater Boston area.

Trinity Cambridge Church (www.trinitycambridge.com) sponsors our meet-up as a way to serve the Cambridge community. They provide free pizza for our meet-ups. We meet at the organizer's home, 217 Thorndike Street, Cambridge, which is a 10-minute walk from the Kendall and Lechmere T-stops. 

We gather every other week on Saturdays from 6-9pm. We specialize in Euro-style tabletop games of medium complexity. After grabbing some slices of pizza, we break into groups to play strategy games to entertain the adults (e.g. Dominion, Settlers of Catan, Avalon, Carcassone, Hanabi, Ticket to Ride, etc.) as well as simpler games to regale the kids (e.g. Dixit, Twirkle, Code Names, Skip-Bo, etc.). Usually, we have a volunteer or two to supervise the kids' games. If you have younger children who are not able to play the games, you will have to watch them yourself. 

Due to the limited space, you must RSVP and inform us of how many people are in your party. For this reason, we ask that you be considerate of others by RSVP'ing only if you are likely to attend. This also allows us to alert you in the event that the meet-up is cancelled.

We welcome beginners and advanced players, and you are invited to bring your own favorite games as well.
results.name: Cambridge Game Night

results.description:
We are a meet-up of Cambridgians who love to play Ultimate Frisbee. We usually play on Saturday mornings from 9-11AM at the Ahern Field behind the Kennedy-Longfellow School in East Cambridge. There is free parking by the field at the school's parking lot on weekends. We welcome players of all skill levels!

We ask that our members RSVP for game so we know we have enough people for a game of Ultimate. We confirm by Friday night 9PM or earlier that the game is on. By RSVP'ing, you also allow us to alert you of last-minute cancellations (usually weather related).

9:00-9:15 AM - Warm up, stretch, and practice. Overview rules and divide into teams.

9:15 AM - Game starts.

Post-game - Hang out, grab lunch.

Please dress appropriately for a game of competitive Ultimate Frisbee. We recommend that you bring white and dark-colored t-shirts so that we can divide into two teams easily. Bring your own water, and we will provide the discs and cones. 

Come join us for Ultimate Frisbee and make new friends in the process!
results.name: Cambridge Frisbee

results.description:
• This writing group began almost two years ago and has now expanded to one day writing retreats!
If you are seeking a full day to re-connect with the voice and heart behind your written words, then join us in this oceanside retreat.
Each writers journey is their spiritual gift and this retreat will honor that.
In addition to morning writing prompts you will have time after lunch to walk the beach or follow the shore road to the harbor entrance.
In the afternoon you can join in more group writing and share a piece of your work or not.
This retreat is not intended to critique your work or your style.
It is also not therapy.
Journal writing by nature can be a wonderful door to leading a more mindful life and the path that the prompts lead you down will be supported and encouraged.
Hopefully you will leave with a greater sense of openness to all that gives you a chance to pause and observe.
Sometimes giving yourself the time and space away from your routine and obligations is all that's needed to find your writing voice.
As a writer and facilitator I will happily open my home once again to women writers who come with blank pages and leave with a deeper sense of their self.
Light breakfast food and lunch will be provided.
Arrival is between 8:30 and 9, starting with our sharing of intentions at 9.
Writing will be guided by prompts between 9:30 and 12. You can choose to write on the porch, deck or in one of the comfortable living spaces . After writing we will have an opportunity to share if desired.
We break from 12-1:30.
The beach and harbor are just outside the door. It's a perfect spot to simply let everything slip away and breathe.
Writing back at the house resumes promptly at 1:30.
Each writer has another opportunity to share a writing piece.
Goodbyes are said at 4:00
results.name: Scituate Journal Writers

results.description:
'Dance well at the Dance Tank.'

Here at Dance Tank United we learn a variety of different dance forms.  Our mission is to create well-rounded dancers who are skilled and can mix it up at any party, anywhere at anytime.

Our main styles that we study each week include Detroit-style ballroom and Chicago style steppin', salsa, grAystone (social), Detroit bop, Chicago style walking, Kansas City 2-step, DC bop, night club 2 step and many more.

We simplify dancing.  We tend to think that all dances can be learned and mastered.  We have an easy to learn approach which is proven to help beginners, intermediates or advanced dance enthusiasts as well. 

Whether you have 2 left feet, or, you're an advanced dancer looking to expand your dance knowledge, either way, Dance Tank United is the perfect group for you.  Join us now and spread the word.

We teach classes twice a week each and every Monday and Tuesday.  Every month we also have a special weekend class with out-of-town guest instructors from Detroit, Chicago, TX, MD, Atlanta, New Hampshire and many more cities.

We believe in:  PRACTICE NO EXCUSES!!  LET'S GO!!

results.description:
Ladies: I intend for this to be a men's group, but if you have interest in what is stated here, believe you could benefit from/provide support to this cause, or just have a preference for smaller gentlemen, feel free to join.

Gentlemen: Are you as cool as Michael J Fox? Are you as funny as Kevin Hart? Do you command authority with the confidence of our lord and savior Mr. Dinklage?

My name is Roy. I am 5'3". Spontaneous enough to try most things once. Passions include singing, writing, yoga and self-improvement.

If you haven't read between the lines yet, this group is for awesome guys who have overcome the daily challenges of being a shorter man. And let's be real; we are all so much cooler in person than we will ever appear to be online.

The national average is around 5'9". I would ask men this height or taller to provide explanation as to why they feel small but awesome if you wish to join.

So let's do something many men do not. Let's meet, at least once a month in a fun environment. Pool our resources, share our experiences, treat each other as equals, provide value to one another on topics from fashion to fitness to football and everything in between. Let us bond as men (not in a gay way (not that there's anything wrong with that)) and develop into a group of solid friends and wingmen.

Early participants will have a strong impact on how this group is shaped. I live in Canton so venue choices will likely be convenient for that general area and involve either billiards or karaoke unless and until I get feedback.

South of Boston division is merely where I intend to keep the majority of the meetings. If you are in another area and would like to start your own group with this concept, feel free to use the name, and be sure to hit me up if your group takes root!
